Class Database

  • java.lang.Object
    • Database

  • public class Database
extends java.lang.Object
    The driver of the program, the controller of the linked list database. This is where tables are initialized, operated on, and printed.
    Version:
    09/21/18
    Author:
    Kevin Filanowski

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static int FIELD_NUMBER
      The number of fields that are needed in one table record

    • Method Detail

      • checkForMissingElements

        private static void checkForMissingElements(java.lang.String filename)
                                     throws java.lang.NoSuchFieldException,
                                            java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Checks for empty record fields. The method will throw an exception if there is not enough information to fill a record in the table. It does this by counting every element in the file, and then knowing that there should be 'FIELD_NUMBER' elements per record in a table, performs a modulus operator to determine if there exists at least one element that is missing.
        Parameters:
        filename - The file's name which will be scanned.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchFieldException - This exception is thrown if there are not enough elements in the file to fill any record.
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • checkInteger

        private static java.lang.String checkInteger(java.lang.String element)
                                      throws java.lang.NumberFormatException
        This method is used to check if an element is an integer. If the element is in fact an integer, it will return the element. If it is not an integer, it will throw an exception.
        Parameters:
        element - The string element to check.
        Returns:
        The same element passed in if the element is a number, throws an exception otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - This exception is thrown if the element is not an integer.

      • checkString

        private static java.lang.String checkString(java.lang.String element)
        Similar to checkInteger, this method will check an element to ensure that it contains only letters, and no numerical digits. This method will throw an exception if it finds any numerical digits in the String 'element', and return the element back if it does not.
        Parameters:
        element - The string element to check for digits.
        Returns:
        The same element passed in if the element does not contain any digits, throws an exception otherwise.

      • menu

        private static void menu(Table<Employee> faculty,
                         Table<Employee> admin)
        The visual and logic part of the menu. The menu has several options that the user can choose from: 0) Quit - Quits the program 1) Intersect - Finds the intersection between two tables 2) Difference - Finds the difference between two tables 3) Union - Finds the union between two tables 4) Select - Select a specified attribute and value in a table 5) Remove - Removes a row from a table 6) Print both tables - Prints both tables
        Parameters:
        faculty - The first table, which consists of faculty members.
        admin - The second table, which consists of administrative members.

      • populateTable

        private static void populateTable(Table<Employee> table,
                                  java.lang.String filename)
                           throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        This method populates a table with information from a text file.
        Parameters:
        table - The table to fill in with records.
        filename - The name of the file to read information from.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - This exception is thrown if the name of file is incorrect or does not exist.

      • printTable

        private static void printTable(Table<Employee> table)
        Simple function that calls the toString method of the table and prints that out. The purpose was to increase readability and reduce keystrokes.
        Parameters:
        table - The table to be printed.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        The main driver. Declares and initializes two tables, and then populates them with information from two separate text files. Calls upon the menu for input commands.
        Parameters:
        args - Any command line arguments. Not necessary in this program.
